author: lundblad
msg: Don't invoke an editor for a lock comment.  Also, error out if a lock
comment or lock comment file is an existing path like the commit-like
(main): Use same rules for -m and -F regarding protection against
the option arg being a path as the other operations taking -m and -F.
(svn_cl__lock): Don't care about a tempfile for lock comment editing.

author: lundblad
msg: * notes/locking/locking-ui.txt: Don't say that svn:needs-lock is an enforcement
system.  Don't say that svn lock invokes the $EDITOR or that a lock comment

author: ghudson
msg: Fix problems in r14066 noted by Peter Lundblad.
(svn_fs_initialize): Document that multiple calls within the
lifetime of the first call's pool will have no effect.
(svn_fs_initialize): Check that common_pool isn't already defined.

author: ghudson
msg: Merge r14063, r14066, r14068, r14079, and r14121, with some changes:
(svn_fs_initialize): Do not introduce this new API (so there are
actually no merged changes to this file).
(svn_fs_initialize, serialized_init): Do not introduce this new API;
common pool initialization is done purely on a best-effort basis
(commit_body, svn_fs__commit): Make a simplified version of the
the write lock (with mutex now), calls commit_body with the
subpool, and releases the write lock.  commit_body contains the
bulk of svn_fs_fs__commit with "subpool" changed to "pool"
as we do on trunk, since part of r14066 is storing data into
